task_summary: The robot arm must pour liquid from a held cup into a mug placed on the table, following a sequential perception, approach, alignment, pouring, and retreat procedure.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic manipulator executing a pour action: transferring contents from a held cup into a mug on a wooden workspace. The system relies on visual perception to locate the mug, approaches and aligns above the target, pours at a standardized tilt angle and rate, and withdraws on completion. Robust perception and safe motion planning are critical for this manipulation task.
preconditions: Cup is already held by the robot gripper.
Mug is present and visible on the workspace.
Pourable material is inside the cup.
stepwise_plan: Visually confirm the mug or search with scanning if not visible.
Move the cup above the mug at a safe offset.
Approach and align for accurate pouring.
Execute pour with fixed tilt and rate until mug is full.
success_criteria: Cup contents transferred to mug with minimal spillage.
Arm retreats without contact with mug.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect mug: retry scan up to 3 times.
Contact or collision: initiate stop and retreat procedure.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after retreat, once pour is complete or maximum attempts exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to robot sensors.
Scans workspace for the mug using grid pattern.
Detects the precise location of the mug.
Moves the held cup above the mug at a safe vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns for precise pouring over the mug.
Pours from the held cup into the mug with specified parameters.
Moves arm away from the mug after pouring is completed.

recovery_strategy: retry mug scan up to 3 times
retreat and abort on alignment/pour failure
assumptions: The pouring vessel is a 'cup' held by the robot as shown in frames, not a 'bottle'.
No explicit force/tolerance specified in the instruction; defaults derived from visual cues and allowed bins.
Amount and pour rate assumed full/normal due to lack of detailed instruction or visible quantity control.
No spillage or dynamic feedback observed in images.

expected_success_criteria: Cup contents are transferred to mug without spillage and robot withdraws safely.
